page.title: 01THE SANDLINGS, GENERALLY
page.content: The Sandlings is a part of East Anglia lying between the Ipswich-Lowestoft road and the coast, originally heath- land. Evidence shows that prehistoric man existed here; today, with one ex- ception it remains sparsely populated. Major developments have changed the landscape. The Forestry Commission, in 1920, started planting, aiming to pro- vide employment by producing softwood, and the RAF airfield,built in 1942, is still in use, now by the US Air Force (USAF), Woodbridge Base, as part of NATO's defence system. Airmen and their families living at the base form the one community. Other land is farmed, with root crops, cereals, and some stock. Apart from the sensitive defence area, the public are able to enjoy walking freely through a district rich in wildlife.
